runs.comm: loosener on a length on off stump to start, and Kamran just has a look and taps into the covers. Both bowler and batsman seem a little uncertain as to how this pitch will play
just the one sighter for Kamran then, as Sidebottom pitches this one a little fuller outside off and Kamran drives handsomely up and over cover! No swing as yet
Sidebottom straightens his line and shortens his length, and Kamran shuffles to off and clips him out to deep square leg
a hint of movement towards the slips but no more than that. Kamran looks to run the ball down behind square but finds the man at gully
short and fast from Sidebottom, but an unflustered Kamran just rocks back and cracks a powerful pull out to the long leg boundary!
tap and run from Kamran as he nudges into the leg side
on a length on off stump, Kamran comes half forward and drives to extra cover
nice, tight line from Bresnan. Kamran's got no room to work with and can only punch to mid-on
the line is good once again, this time Bresnan is a little fuller but Kamran can only pick out that man at mid-on
top-edged pull, a steepling chance to mid-on and Kamran falls! Deja vu from his dismissal in the first game, the ball, the shot and the result are all the same!
tucked wide of midwicket and a quick single is immediately called for, Shahzaib off the mark. Good running
sharp yorker from Bresnan first ball! Yousuf slams the bat down to dig it out just in time!
bouncer to start! Which is, I'm pretty sure, just how Broad started in the last game! It was really rather too short, however, and Yousuf was easily underneath it
Yousuf is squared up a touch as Broad bangs another one in back of a length. No major drama

dropped by Morgan at backward point! It was short and wait, Yousuf went for a scything cut but couldn't keep it down. A head high chance flew straight to him but he couldn't hold on, parrying the chance over his head
slightly leg-sidish from Broad, and Shahzaib clips him neatly behind square for a couple
another quick bouncer from Broad, whistling high over leg stump as Shahzaib shuffles to off and attempts a hook, but can't lay bat on ball
Broad continues with the short-pitched attack, this time striking Shahzaib on the glove as he tries to work him to fine leg
aggression from Yousuf! It was a full ball from Bresnan but not a half-volley by any means. But Yousuf picked up the length early, aiming a wristy chip out to deep midwicket

bouncer from Bresnan, and it's pulled ...  but straight to Bopara at deep square leg! Again he picked up the length early, deliberately pulled the ball in the air but just couldn't get the connection he was hoping for. Pakistan wobble...
Umar chops down past gully to get off the mark first ball... that should have been an easy two, but he dropped his bat as he reached the non-striker's end!
beaten outside off, a nondescript waft at a back of a length delivery outside off
Shahzaib tries to guide another short of length delivery down behind square, but the ball just rushes on to him and cramps him for room a touch too
bouncer to finish the over, and Shahzaib is content to duck underneath it
Umar gets his feet moving straight away, getting into a nice position to dab a length delivery down to third man

another bouncer from Broad, and this time he's got the wicket! Shahzaib tried to get across to the off side and hook to fine leg, but the ball was simply too quick for him, kissing the glove on the way through to the keeper

play-and-a-miss first ball! It was a nervous looking stroke from Afridi, he just stood at the crease - the feet hardly moving an inch - and thrust the bat out. Lucky not to edge that! And a slip is brought in - Collingwood
straighter from Broad, Afridi looks to nudge him to midwicket but can't beat the field
short again from Broad, and a half-hearted pull is spooned out to deep square leg! Again, Afridi has some luck as the connection was so bad that it dropped short of the fielder on the boundary

another one goes, and this is a big blow for Pakistan! Back of a length from Broad, and the ball is met with a wild, baseball-style swipe from Afridi. It's unclear where he was trying to hit that, but the ball takes a thick top edge and goes straight up. Morgan gets easily underneath it and he's not going to drop that! Pakistan in real trouble now
attempted yorker, it slips out as a low, dipping full toss on off stump that's dug out to cover
good length outside off and a hint of away movement off the seam. Hafeez looks to guide the ball to gully but is beaten on the top edge
fuller, straighter and going the other way off the seam. Hafeez presses forward and defends with bat and pad close together
good bouncer from Bresnan, shooting over the top of off stump as Hafeez buckles his knees to get underneath it
on a length on off stump, and Hafeez opts for the safe route, defending to cover
Bresnan slips onto leg stump, and Hafeez nudges him behind square on the leg side to get off the mark
Broad continues, and in very much the same mode of attack - short and fast. The batsman ducks underneath
the length is slightly fuller this time, but still by no means full. Hafeez gets into a good position and cracks the ball nicely out of the middle, but straight to extra cover
pitching middle and leg, Hafeez shuffles across and picks up a quick single on the leg side
and Umar follows suit, glancing to fine leg
Broad re-adjusts his line, and Hafeez punches past Morgan at point for one
that was almost suicidal from Umar, pushing the ball straight to Morgan and thinking about a single, Hafeez is having none of it and wisely sends him back
chopped down behind square on the off side, but there's no single to be had
fuller, straighter, quicker, and Hafeez drives back to the bowler
this one keeps low to beat the bottom edge of Hafeez's attempted cut!
full on off stump, and defended back down the track
Hafeez looks for a single behind square on the off side, but again he can't beat the field!
desperate paddle-sweep from Hafeez, he top-edges the attempt but it falls safely behind the keeper
right on the spot straight away, and nudged straight back to the bowler
flicked to midwicket
Hafeez gets right across to off on bended knee and sweeps out to deep square leg
well, Pakistan are struggling but Umar isn't! He charges out and absolutely hammers Swann straight back over his head and into the sightscreen! Big, big six
and he follows that up with a delicate reverse-sweep. He can't quite get it away though, and they take a single as the man at 45 comes round
full, straight and Hafeez drills back to the bowler
quick and flat through the air, speared down the leg side and Davies scoots round for a good stop. There's an appeal for a catch, but that clipped the pad
slashed away but straight to backward point
straighter from Yardy, and Umar nudges to midwicket for one
short and wide, a real "hit-me" ball, and Hafeez cracks it very hard ... but straight to the cover sweeper

close to the stumping! The ball clipped Umar's pad, and went nowhere. He thought about the run but Davies leapt forward in a flash to grab the ball and break the stumps... But the third umpire confirms he's safe!
dabbed down behind square on the off side
turned off the pads round the corner for a single to bring Umar on strike
top shot! Well played Umar, skipping down the track and depositing this straight back down the ground into the sight screen

great stuff from Swann, what a response! Cool as you like. Having watched the last disappear over his head Swann throws this up much slower, a touch wider, Umar runs at it and hacks wildly, only for the ball to spin back and crash into the stumps, Swann smiles wryly, knowing he's out-thought the youngster
very carefully defended off the front foot
early single, off a leading edge down the wicket for a single
bit of an appeal from Swann as Hafeez stretches forward to defend and it loops off the pads to Davies
Yardy's stranglehold continues as he fires in another on a length and line
runs here, Yardy a touch wide and it skews off the outside edge towards third man for a couple
nothing available here for Razzaq, fired in, cramping the batsman
slung in quickly again, no room for Razzaq to swing his arms
this is excellent control bowling, just cramping Razzaq
fired in even quicker, Razzak trapped on the back foot unable to do anything but poke at the ball
this is worked away for a single
beaten on the outside edge, slightly quicker from Swann, sliding past the edge
ooh, this is very close, Razzaq has a big heave-ho outside off, he's dragged his foot out but as Davies goes to make the stumping Razzaq gets a fraction of his boot back within the crease
big spin for Swann, he's really giving it a rip, a touch shorter and it jags into Razzak who pokes it into the leg side suspiciously
single taken for Hafeez in calm style here, prodded towards cover
touch slower and fuller from Swann, but with the turn around Razzaq is reluctant to tee off, so instead defends carefully
Yardy's arm is very low here, really slinging it in and Hafeez can't do anything with the angle created
Hafeez tries to give himself some room by skipping outside leg stump but the ball is on him in a flash and cramping him
four this time! Good shot too, calmly driving through the off side, beating Collingwood at short cover
tries to sweep this time, but he can't get anything on it
once again Hafeez looks for some room, but he can't find it as Yardy fires it in from wide of the crease
single takes this time, though it was a touch uncomfortable, defending in the air back towards the bowler

another gone, run out by a distance here, Hafeez looked for a reverse-sweep, failed to connect and it came off his body towards Sidebottom at short fine leg, Razzaq called him through for a single but Hafeez took an age to reach the bowler's end and Sidebottom's throw came in quick enough to Swann to do the rest
misfield from Broad at short third man earns a glare from Swann, Razzaq opened the face to guide it towards him and Broad made a hash of it, allowing a single
Swann may thank Broad after all! Alam gone first ball trying to cut off the back foot, touch of spin, gets a faint outside edge and Davies clings on. Absolute procession here
Umar Gul gets a quicker ball first up, not turning as much as all the others and it runs off the face towards third man for a single
this spins a long way from middle stump down the leg side, Davies makes a smart take but it's a wide
nicely played by Razzaq here, crashing a drive through cover for a single
too much spin again here for Swann, and it runs away past Davies for wides
Swann finishes his spell with a tossed-up delivery outside off that is stroked rather stylishly down the ground
poor start from Sidebottom, short and down the leg side
beaten outside off stump, nothing shot from Gul, just fencing aimlessly at it
good delivery here, back of a length around off stump, Gul swishing and getting a thick inside edge that trickles into the leg side
once again Sidebottom locates a good length and line, not pitching it up to Razzaq, and it's defended off the back foot
Razzaq is not happy with the ball dug in short at him and his attempted pull comes off the body and rolls gently to short fine leg
poor old Sidebottom, this won't help his figures, back of a length and Gul tried to swing away a pull shot, it came off the top edge and went straight over Davies for a boundary
much fuller to end the over over, Gul swings it down to long-on to keep the strike
banged in short first up, England have used the short ball a lot today, Gul crouches underneath it
here's something to cheer for the Pakistan crowds, shortish again from Broad and Gul eased a pull shot over deep square for a maximum!
slightly less elegant hack at this from Gul, but effective enough to find a single down to long-on
slower ball to Razzaq, who gently opens the face to give Gul back the strike. Who's the main batsman out there?
Gul standing deep in his crease waiting for the short ball, it wasn't all that short from Broad but Gul slapped away a pull shot anyway and got a single for his efforts

big appeal from England as Broad sends one down the leg side, Razzaq flapped at it and there was a big sound, could only have been bat but given not out. Broad can't believe it, but he rarely can when decisions don't go his way
full and straight from Sidebottom, jabbed out back towards the bowler, who falls in a heap as he attempts to dive. Not pretty, but he'll argue he got the job done
slower-ball bouncer, Gul runs well outside off stump to try and swing it away but he's defeated by the lack of pace and it bobbles off his  body for one
Razzaq finally has a boundary, and it's well played too, scything a cut shot out to deep point where, despite a heroic effort, Bresnan's slide can't reach it
another falls, slower ball from Sidebottom who manages a smile now, Razzaq tried to slug this over deep midwicket but could only find a top edge that looped towards slip

Two in two! Another wicket for Sidebottom, who's smile is even broader now. Slower-ball bouncer once more, Gul tried to pull it away but could only manage a top edge that looped towards deep square where Bopara ran in and slid on his knees to pouch the catch
won't get one here, fuller outside off, Ajmal pokes it to point safely
Shoaib backs away towards the leg side, Bresnan follows him with a shorter ball and it beats the outside edge
Shoaib is off and in some style too! Again giving himself some room but this time Bresnan went full and Shoaib clattered it, all along the ground, through extra cover for four
Shoaib tries to repeat the dose but Bresnan hammers it in much shorter and Shoaib can't connect
that is that. All over. Abject effort from Pakistan ends with Shoaib backing away and missing a full toss that crashes into middle stump. England will need 90 to win
